ZA-EC | website = www.ecprov.gov.za | footnotes = }} The Eastern Cape is a province of South Africa. Its capital is Bhisho. Its two largest cities are Port Elizabeth and East London. It was formed in 1994. It was the home of the 1820 settlers. The central and eastern part of the province is the traditional home of the Xhosa people. This region is the birthplace of many famous South African politicians, such as Nelson Mandela, Oliver Tambo, Walter Sisulu, Govan Mbeki, Raymond Mhlaba, Robert Mangaliso Sobukwe, Chris Hani, Thabo Mbeki, Steve Biko and Charles Coghlan. ==References== ==Other websites== *Eastern Cape National Government information *Eastern Cape Provincial Government *Eastern Cape Socio-Economic Consultative Council *Eastern Cape Tourism Board *Eastern Cape Development Corporation Category:1994 establishments in South Africa
title: Eastern Cape
